info.title: Domain Analysis API
info.description:
### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 — Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

tags.name: Domain Analysis
tags.description: Methods to get SEO characteristics for domains

post.description:
Method `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainsInfo` provides the summary SEO information for an array of domains for specified search engine database.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 5 API credits are spent per each domain in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

data.description: Contains separate response for every domain your requested

keywords.description: Number of keywords found in the chosen search engine

traff.description: Estimated search traffic based on keyword positions and search volume

visible_dynamic.description: Change in visibility since the last monitoring

keywords_dynamic.description: Change in the number of keywords since the last monitoring

traff_dynamic.description: Traffic change since the last monitoring

ads_dynamic.description: Dynamics of changes in PPC Ads

new_keywords.description: Number of new keywords for the domain since the last monitoring found in SERPs

out_keywords.description: Number of keywords lost by a domain since the last monitoring

rised_keywords.description: Number of domain keywords for which positions have improved since the last monitoring

down_keywords.description: Number of domain keywords for which positions have dropped since the last monitoring

domains.description:
List of domains you want get data for.

If you would get data for one domain - provide array with one member, eg. `["example.com"]`

data.description: Contains 2-4 week data points for given domain

keywords.description: Number of keywords seen in SEPSs for given search engine

traff.description: Estimated search traffic based on keyword positions and search volume

visible_static.description: Change in visibility since the last monitoring

new_keywords.description: Number of new keywords since the last 2-4 weeks

out_keywords.description: Number of lost keywords since the last N-days monitoring

rised_keywords.description: Number of keywords which positions of the domain have improved over the last N-days

down_keywords.description: Number of keywords which positions of the domain have dropped over the last N-days

date.description: Date when the metrics were recorded

left_lines.description: API credits remaining after this request

post.description:
Method **SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainsHistory** provides you with the historical data on a domain’s number of keywords and visibility. 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per member of `data` object array in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


If no data found you will receive error:
```json
{
  "id": "1",
  "error": {
    "code": 32017,
    "message": "Data not found",
    "data": null
  }
}
```

during_all_time.description:
History period: if `true` -  get information on All time,
`false` - get information on year to date

sort.description: Order of sorting the results in the format: {field: order}

out_keywords.description: Number of keywords that dropped out.

rised_keywords.description: Number of keywords that increased in rank.

down_keywords.description: Number of keywords that decreased in rank.

ad_keywords.description: Number of keywords used in paid ads.

size.description: Number of results per page in response

subdomain.description: Subdomain appeared in search results for a given keyword

keyword.description: Keyword which the domain ranks for

keyword_length.description: Number of words divided by space in a keyword

url.description: URL appeared in the search result for the query

types.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, `video`, `carousel` or `map`)

found_results.description: Number of results found for the keyword

region_queries_count.description: Search volume in a selected region

region_queries_count_wide.description: Search volume in selected search engine database in broad match

geo_names.description: List of toponyms in the array (if toponyms are present in the keywords)

traff.description: Approximate traffic by keyword depending on its volume and position

difficulty.description: The assessment of the level of competition for a keyword to advance in organic search in the top-10 (from 0 to 100%)

total.description: Number of keywords which the domain ranks for in top of search results

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainKeywords` method return keywords which the analyzed domain ranks for in Google top-100 search results. The data set is similar to the Domain analysis — SEO research — Keywords report. 
You can get up to 60 000 results in this report.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per member of `data` object array in response. 

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request. 


With the Serpstat API, you can only get the first 60,000 results, regardless of the number and size of the queries themselves. For more data - use the export option in the Domain Analysis, Keyword Analysis, or URL Analysis sections, or contact the manager for a personal upload of the results.

withIntents.description: Keyword intent. This parameter works for `g_ua` and `g_us` database only

keywords.description: Array of keywords to search for

minusKeywords.description: List of keywords to exclude from the search

cost.description: Cost per click (in US $; exact match)

cost_from.description: Cost per click (in US $; exact match) from

cost_to.description: Cost per click (in US $; exact match) to

position.description: Keyword position (any whole number in the range of 1-100)

position_from.description: Keyword position from (any whole number in the range of 1-100)

position_to.description: Keyword position to (any whole number in the range of 1-100)

concurrency.description: Competition (how hard it is to promote a keyword to the top, from 1-100)

concurrency_from.description: Competition (from, how hard it is to promote a keyword to the top, from 1-100)

concurrency_to.description: Competition (to, how hard it is to promote a keyword to the top, from 1-100)

keyword_length.description: Number of words in the keyword

difficulty_from.description: The difficulty of the keyword from

difficulty_to.description: The difficulty of the keyword to

region_queries_count.description: Volume of the keyword by the selected region

region_queries_count_from.description: Volume of the keyword by the selected region from

region_queries_count_to.description: Volume of the keyword by the selected region to

region_queries_count_wide.description: Volume of the keyword in broad match

region_queries_count_wide_from.description: Volume of the keyword in broad match from

region_queries_count_wide_to.description: Volume of the keyword in broad match to

url_contains.description: Exact website pages ranking for the keywords

right_spelling.description: Display or not display misspelled keywords

keyword_not_contain.description: Does not contain all keywords (exact matching)

keyword_contain_one_of.description: Contains one of the keywords (exact matching)

keyword_not_contain_one_of.description: Does not contain one of the keywords (exact matching)

keyword_not_contain_broad_match.description: Does not contain all keywords (broad match)

keyword_contain_one_of_broad_match.description: Contains one of the keywords (broad match)

keyword_not_contain_one_of_broad_match.description: Does not contain one of the keywords (broad match)

intents_contain.description: Contains one or several of intents

intents_not_contain.description: Does not contain one of the intents

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: {field: order}

Default: `{"position": "asc", "region_queries_count": "desc"}`

region_queries_count.description: Sort by keyword search volume, where 'asc' means ascending and 'desc' means descending.

types.description: Sort by special elements associated with the keywords, with 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

cost.description: Sort by the keyword cost per click (CPC), with 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

keyword_length.description: Sort by the length of the keyword (number of words), with 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

concurrency.description: Sort by concurrency, indicating the availability or competition for the keyword, with 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

geo_names.description: Sort by the toponyms (geographic locations) related to the keyword, with 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

traff.description: Sort by the traffic associated with the keyword, with 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

region_queries_count_wide.description: Sort by the keyword volume in broad match, where 'asc' means ascending and 'desc' means descending.

dynamic.description: Sort by keyword dynamic, indicating how often the keyword changes, with 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

position.description: Sort by the position of the keyword, with 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

found_results.description: Sort by the number of results found for the keyword, with 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

size.description: Number of results per page in response

data.description: Data object, contained main response data.

domain.description: Rival domain. One of the responses could contain your domain, specified in the request.

keywords.description: The number of keywords of domain ranged in SERPs for specified search engine database `se`.

traff.description: Estimated search traffic for rival domain.

visible_dynamic.description: Changes in rival domain visibility. Positive value - good

keywords_dynamic.description: Changes in ranged keywords. Positive value is good.

traff_dynamic.description: change in estimated search traffic of rival domains.

ads_dynamic.description: Change in ads numbers of rival domains

new_keywords.description: recently appared keywords in SERPs of rival domains

out_keywords.description: Recently dropped from SERPs keywords of rival domains.

rised_keywords.description: Recently moved up in SERPs keywords of rival domains.

down_keywords.description: Number of keywords out of SERPs

intersected.description: The number of common keywords for rival domains and requested domain.

common.description: The number of common keywords for rival domains and requested domain.

relevance.description: Relevance of keyword sets of rival domains

new_relevance.description: Volume of intersected new keywords with rival domains

our_relevance.description: Volume of intersected out of SERP keywords with rival domains

missing.description:
Number of keywords that present in SERP for rival domain and missing for requested domain.
This parameter not present for requested domain.

not_intersected.description:
Number of keywords that present in SERP for rival domain and missing for requested domain.
This parameter not present for requested domain.

summary_info.description: Object contains data about API credits and paginations

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getCompetitors` method brings in the list of domain competitors in top 20 Google search results. 
The data set is similar to the [Competitors report](https://serpstat.com/domains/competitors/?query=&se=g_us&search_type=subdomains) of the domain.

<!-- theme: success -->
> Credits: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

<!-- theme: danger -->
> This method is deprecated from 2023-03-01

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

visible_from.description: The minimum visibility score to apply the filter.

visible_to.description: The maximum visibility score to apply the filter.

traff_from.description: The minimum traffic score to apply the filter.

traff_to.description: The maximum traffic score to apply the filter.

minus_domains.description: A list of domain names to exclude from the search.

keywords.description: The total number of keywords associated with the filter.

keywords_from.description: The minimum number of keywords to apply the filter.

keywords_to.description: The maximum number of keywords to apply the filter.

relevance_from.description: The minimum relevance score to apply the filter.

relevance_to.description: The maximum relevance score to apply the filter.

sort.description: **Optional**. With this sorting options, you can sort by one of response parameters.  Default sorting is `"relevance":"desc"`

relevance.description: **Default sort**. Sort by by relevance of keyword sets of rival domains

visible.description: Sort by visibility of competitiors domains

keywords.description: total keywords in top of rival domain

traff.description: Sort by estimated search traffic of rival domains

visible_dynamic.description: Sort by change in visibility of rival domains

keywords_dynamic.description: Sort by change in keywords count of rival domains

traff_dynamic.description: Sort by change in estimated search traffic of rival domains

new_keywords.description: Sort by change in recently appared keywords in SERPs of rival domains

ads_dynamic.description: Sort by change in ads numbers of rival domains

out_keywords.description: Sort by change in recently dropped from SERPs keywords of rival domains

rised_keywords.description: Sort by change in recently moved up in SERPs keywords of rival domains

down_keywords.description: Sort by change in recently moved down in SERPs keywords of rival domains

ad_keywords.description: Sort by ads keywords of rival domains

ads.description: Sort by ads numbers of rival domains

intersected.description: Sort by volume of intersected keywords with rival domains

new_relevance.description: Sort by volume of intersected new keywords with rival domains

our_relevance.description: Sort by volume of intersected out of SERP keywords with rival domains

size.description: Size of report, by default - 100, you can specify lower value - 5

data.title: Nike® Official Site
data.text: Your New Favorite Nike® Gear — Shop exclusive new styles crafted with the latest Nike® technology & innovations now. Gear up with shoes & clothes designed for performance & comfort. Shop Nike® now.

data.title: Free Shipping On Orders $75+
data.text: Your New Favorite Nike® Gear — Shop last minute gifts with Nike® - use code LASTSHOT for an extra 25% off select styles. Save up to 50% off on last minute gifts with Nike® - find the perfect gift today.

keyword.description: Keyword the analyzed domain bids on in Google Ads

keyword_length.description: Number of words divided by space in a keyword

type.description: Ad placement type in relation to SERP (1 - above; 2 - under; 3 - side)

found_results.description: Number of results found for the keyword

region_queries_count.description: Search volume in selected search engine database

types.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, `video`, `carousel` or `map`)

geo_names.description: List of toponyms in the array (if toponyms are present in the keywords)

difficulty.description: The assessment of the level of competition for a keyword to advance in organic search in the top-10 (from 0 to 100%)

data.title: Nike® Official Site
data.text: Your New Favorite Nike® Gear — Shop exclusive new styles crafted with the latest Nike® technology & innovations now. Gear up with shoes & clothes designed for performance & comfort. Shop Nike® now.

data.title: Free Shipping On Orders $75+
data.text: Your New Favorite Nike® Gear — Shop last minute gifts with Nike® - use code LASTSHOT for an extra 25% off select styles. Save up to 50% off on last minute gifts with Nike® - find the perfect gift today.

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAdKeywords` method searches for keywords in paid search results and advertising listings for a specific domain.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per member of `data` object array in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


The number of charged credits corresponds to the number of results obtained upon request.

keywords.description: Array of keywords to search for

minusKeywords.description: List of keywords to exclude from the search

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

position.description: The exact position of the keyword in search results, e.g., 1.

position_from.description: The minimum position of the keyword in search results.

position_to.description: The maximum position of the keyword in search results.

queries.description: The exact number of queries, e.g., 5.

region_queries_count.description: The volume of the keyword by the selected region, e.g., 1000.

region_queries_count_from.description: The minimum volume of the keyword by the selected region.

region_queries_count_to.description: The maximum volume of the keyword by the selected region.

region_queries_count_wide.description: The broad volume of the keyword across multiple regions, e.g., 1000.

region_queries_count_wide_from.description: The minimum broad volume of the keyword.

region_queries_count_wide_to.description: The maximum broad volume of the keyword.

difficulty.description: The difficulty level of the keyword, e.g., 3.

difficulty_from.description: The minimum difficulty level of the keyword.

difficulty_to.description: The maximum difficulty level of the keyword.

minus_url.description: Excludes results from a specific URL, e.g., https://www.apple.com/airpods-2nd-generation/.

pm_url.description: Filters results by a specific URL, e.g., https://www.apple.com/airpods/.

right_spelling.description: Filters by spelling correction. If true, results will include corrected spelling; if false, only exact spelling is used.

misspelled.description: Filters misspelled queries. If true, only misspelled keywords are included; if false, only correctly spelled keywords are shown.

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: {field: order}

Default: `{"cost": "asc"}`

keyword_length.description: Sort by the number of words in the keyword.

found_results.description: Sort by the number of found results.

region_queries_count.description: Sort by the number of queries in the selected region.

region_queries_count_wide.description: Sort by the number of queries across multiple regions.

size.description: Number of results per page in response

200.description:
OK

Returns data in `.csv` format.

Columns: `"Domain","Keyword","Position","Position dynamic","Keyword volume","CPC","Competition in PPC","Keyword length","URL","Snippets","Results found","Approximate traffic"`

post.description:
Method `SerpstatDomainProcedure.exportPositions` retuns in `CSV` format domains positions and keywords.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per row in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.


> **Note**: This method retuns data in CSV format.

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

right_spelling.description: Filters by spelling correction. If true, results will include corrected spelling; if false, only exact spelling is used.

position_dynamic.description:
Filters results by position dynamics:
- 'new' for newly appearing results,
- 'rise' for results that have moved up,
- 'down' for results that have moved down.

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: {field: order}

Default: `{"cost": "asc"}`

region_queries_count.description: Sort by the number of queries in the selected region.

region_queries_count_wide.description: Sort by the number of queries across multiple regions.

found_results.description: Sort by the number of found results.

size.description: Number of results per page in response

intersected.description: Number of keywords bringing users to an analyzed domain and its competitor via paid results

missing_keywords.description: Number of keywords that competitor use in PPC and analyzed domain does not use

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAdsCompetitors` method returns a list of competing domains in paid search results. It's similar to the "Competitors" report in domain PPC analysis in Serpstat UI.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: {field: order}

Default: `{"relevance":"desc"}`

ads.description: Sort by the number of ads.

keywords.description: Sort by the number of keywords.

intersected.description: Sort by the number of intersected keywords.

missing_keywords.description: Sort by the number of missing keywords.

size.description: Number of results per page in response

regions_count.description: Number of the database's in the search result

total_traff.description: Sum of the traffic in all database

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getAllRegionsTraffic` method returns an array with information about the amount of traffic by domain in Serpstat databases. Databases with a number of keywords equal to zero are not shown in the response.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

keywords.description: Number of keywords which the URL ranks for

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainUrls` method returns the list of URLs within the analyzed domain and the number of keywords for each URL.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

url_prefix.description: Filters results to URLs that start with the given prefix.

url_contain.description: Filters results to URLs that contain the specified substring.

url_not_contain.description: Excludes results with URLs that contain the specified substring.

sort.description:
Order of sorting the results in the format: {field: order}

Default: `{"keywords":"desc"}`

keywords.description: Sort by the number of keywords

size.description: Number of results per page in response

keyword.description: The keyword by which the specified website is ranked

keyword_length.description: Number of words divided by space in a keyword

types.description:
List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, video, carousel or map)
Reffer to [full list of value types](/docs/serpstat-public-api/3vs2ueyhe5j08-snippets-types)

found_results.description: Number of results found for the keyword

geo_names.description: List of toponyms in the array (if toponyms are present in the keywords)

traff.description: Estimated search traffic based on keyword positions and search volume

domain3.description: Domain which ranks for the keyword (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

subdomain3.description: Subdomain which ranks for the keyword (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

url3.description: URL of a page which appears in SERP for the keyword  (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

position3.description: Positions of the compared domains for a given keyword (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

dynamic3.description: How the position of the domain by this keyword has changed (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

domain1.description: Domain which ranks for the keyword (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

subdomain1.description: Subdomain which ranks for the keyword (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

dynamic1.description: How the position of the domain by this keyword has changed (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

url2.description: URL of a page which appears in SERP for the keyword  (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

position2.description: Positions of the compared domains for a given keyword (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

dynamic2.description: How the position of the domain by this keyword has changed (the index corresponds to the serial number in the domains field of the request)

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainsIntersection` method returns common keywords of up to 3 domains. 
The data set is similar to the Domain vs domain report.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

domains.description: Array of domain names, minimum 2, maximum 3

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

right_spelling.description: Include or exclude correctly spelled keywords.

cost.description: Exact cost per click (in USD, exact match).

cost_from.description: Minimum cost per click (in USD, exact match).

cost_to.description: Maximum cost per click (in USD, exact match).

region_queries_count.description: Exact search volume for the selected region.

region_queries_count_from.description: Minimum search volume for the selected region.

region_queries_count_wide.description: Exact search volume in broad match.

region_queries_count_to.description: Maximum search volume for the selected region.

region_queries_count_wide_from.description: Minimum search volume in broad match.

region_queries_count_wide_to.description: Maximum search volume in broad match.

keyword_length.description: Exact number of words in a keyword.

keyword_length_from.description: Minimum number of words in a keyword.

keyword_length_to.description: Maximum number of words in a keyword.

traff.description: Exact traffic volume for the keyword.

traff_from.description: Minimum traffic volume for the keyword.

traff_to.description: Maximum traffic volume for the keyword.

position.description: Exact position in SERP for the keyword.

position_from.description: Minimum osition in SERP for the keyword.

position_to.description: Maximum position in SERP for the keyword.

size.description: Number of results per page in response

subdomain.description: Subdomain displayed in search result by the given keyword

keyword.description: Keyword which the domain ranks for

keyword_length.description: Number of words divided by space in a keyword

url.description: URLs displayed in SERP by the given keyword

date.description: Search result issue date in format `YYYY-MM-DD`

types.description: List of special elements shown in SERP (for example, `video`, `carousel` or `map`)

found_results.description: Number of results found for keyword

geo_names.description: List of toponyms in the array (if toponyms are present in the keywords)

traff.description: Approximate traffic by keyword depending on its volume and position

difficulty.description: The assessment of the level of competition for a keyword to advance in organic search in the top-10 (from 0 to 100%)

{domain_name}.description:
Positions of the analyzed domains for a keyword.

Example: `"adidas.com": 52, "nike.com": 1`

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getDomainsUniqKeywords` method returns unique keywords of two domains that the third domain does not rank for. The data set is similar to the Domain vs domain report.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

minusDomain.description: Domain with keywords which must not intersect domains parameters.

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic. Numeric range fields (`_from` and `_to`) allow specifying minimum and maximum values. List fields (`_contain` and `_not_contain`) specify inclusion or exclusion criteria

right_spelling.description: Include or exclude correctly spelled keywords.

queries.description: Exact number of keyword searches per month.

queries_from.description: Minimum number of keyword searches per month.

queries_to.description: Maximum number of keyword searches per month.

cost.description: Exact cost per click (in USD, exact match).

cost_from.description: Minimum cost per click (in USD, exact match).

cost_to.description: Maximum cost per click (in USD, exact match).

region_queries_count.description: Exact search volume for the selected region.

region_queries_count_from.description: Minimum search volume for the selected region.

region_queries_count_to.description: Maximum search volume for the selected region.

region_queries_count_wide.description: Exact search volume in broad match.

region_queries_count_wide_from.description: Minimum search volume in broad match.

region_queries_count_wide_to.description: Maximum search volume in broad match.

keyword_length.description: Exact number of words in a keyword.

keyword_length_from.description: Minimum number of words in a keyword.

keyword_length_to.description: Maximum number of words in a keyword.

traff.description: Exact traffic volume for the keyword.

traff_from.description: Minimum traffic volume for the keyword.

traff_to.description: Maximum traffic volume for the keyword.

position.description: Exact keyword position in the SERP.

position_from.description: Minimum keyword position in the SERP.

position_to.description: Maximum keyword position in the SERP.

size.description: Number of results per page in response

favicon.description: Direct link to the site's favicon

all.description: The total number of keywords of the site.

currentValue.description: Current value of the keywords number.

dynamicValue.description: Dynamics of the keywords number in comparison with the previous data update.

common.description: The number of common keywords in competing domains containing the analyzed

currentValue.description: Current value of the keywords number.

dynamicValue.description: Dynamics of the keywords number in comparison with the previous data update.

visibility.description: Visibility of a domain in top-20 search results. It's a relative indicator, which is calculated as a ratio of the amount and popularity of keywords a domain is shown for.

currentValue.description: Current value of the keywords number.

dynamicValue.description: Dynamics of the keywords number in comparison with the previous data update.

missing.description: Number of keywords for which the competing domain is ranked and which are missing from the searched domain

relevance.description: Relevance - calculates the percentage of similar keywords domains share (0-100%)

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getOrganicCompetitorsPage` method brings in the list of domain competitors in top 20 Google search results. The data set is similar to the Competitors report of the domain.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

missing.description: Sort by missing keywords (asc — ascending, desc — descending).

size.description: Number of results per page in response

data.country_name_en: Congo, The Democratic Republic of the
Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha

country_name_en.description: Name of the database's country in English

keywords_count.description: Number of keywords in the database

regions_db_count.description: Number of the database's in the search result

total_keywords.description: Sum of the keywords in all databases

data.country_name_en: Congo, The Democratic Republic of the
Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha

post.description:
The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getRegionsCount` returns an array with information about the number of keys per domain in Serpstat databases. Databases with a number of keys equal to zero are not shown in the response.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

The `SerpstatDomainProcedure.getTopUrls` method returns website pages that rank for the largest amount of the analyzed keyword variations and have the highest traffic. 
The data set is similar to the Top pages report of the Keyword Analysis. 

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one `result` array member in `data` object in response.

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Starting June 15, 2025, this method will consume 1 API credit even when no data is available for the requested query. Previously, no credits were consumed for empty results.

filters.description: Filters for search. Fields are combined using the **AND** logic.

url_prefix.description: Filters results by URLs that start with the given prefix.

url_contain.description: Filters results by URLs that contain the given substring.

url_not_contain.description: Filters results by URLs that do not contain the given substring.

url.description: Filters results to show only exact matching URLs.

minus_url.description: Excludes results that match the given URL.

pm_url.description: Filters results by URLs that partially match the given pattern.

organic_keywords.description: Sort by the number of organic keywords (asc — ascending, desc — descending).

facebook_shares.description: Sort by the number of Facebook shares.

basic-filters.title: basic filters
basic-filters.description: Optional combinations of filters applied to your request. In most cases one filter is enough. Filter combinations have `AND` logic.

traff.description: filter results match exact given traffic value

traff_from.description: filters results that exceed given traffic value

traff_to.description: filter results that bellow given traffic value

visible_from.description: filter results that exceed given visibility value

visible_to.description: filter results that bellow given visibility value

basic-filters-w-date.title: basic filters with date
basic-filters-w-date.description: Optional combinations of filters applied to your request. In most cases one filter is enough. Filter combinations have `AND` logic.

traff.description: filter results match exact given traffic value

traff_from.description: filters results that exceed given traffic value

traff_to.description: filter results that bellow given traffic value

visible_from.description: filter results that exceed given visibility value

visible_to.description: filter results that bellow given visibility value

se.title: search engines short names
se.description:
Example `"se":"g_us"`. 
Reffer to full list of [search engines](../serpstat-public-api/ba97ni814ao9p-search-engine-short-names)

id.title: id
id.description: Request / response identifier, prodvided from your side, will be mirrored from request to `id` in response. Example "id":"123"
